text: today's digital camcorders have
exceptional quality very close to
professional and yet you can probably
tell in about five seconds whether a
piece of footage was professionally shot
or shot by an amateur I think the
primary problem here is that it wasn't
shot on a tripod the difference between
amateur footage and professional footage
very often is that the amateur footage
is not steady first of all use the human
tripod a little thing I like to call
your elbows hold the camera with two
hands but your elbows against your
ribcage this is extremely steady when
especially in conjunction with that
built-in image stabilizer by a quirk of
science it turns out that the average
table lamp has screw heads right here by
happy coincidence they are exactly the
same diameter of a camcorder tripod
socket and there you go instant
improvised tripod let's face it if we
work for kids and pets there would be no
camcorders in the world at all but
notice the camera angle dan is shooting
down on his own kid all he's succeeding
in doing is creating a memory of his own
view when you're shooting children or
pets take the camcorder like this and go
to the kid or the pets level like this
compare that bit of footage with footage
of my own cute blonde headed boy filming
him at child's eye view so you get a
memory of sort of his version of the
memories of that day and one more thing
about children and pets they never
perform on cue so tape is cheap let the
camera roll you can always go home and
edit out the boring parts I've got more
tips for you too on lighting sound
editing and uploading to the web but
you're gonna have to watch the complete
TV episode for that one
